description: This module introduces students to how the concept of race has been represented across a global range of media forms, including photography, documentary, mainstream and arthouse cinema, network television and social media. The module investigates a broad range of critical theories on race, representation, and globalisation, including (but not limited to) colour-blindness, cultural difference and diaspora, raced bodies, and multiculturalism. Upon completing this module, students will be able to critically analyse representations of race within both contemporary and historical global media productions.
title: Race, Media, and Representation
